intro: Senecio sulcicalyx, commonly known as the serrated sun-cup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers with a central disk. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
